meanings.definition: To form an ulcer or ulcers.
meanings.sent1: The cut on his leg was ulcering, causing him pain.
meanings.sent2: She worried about the wound ulcering and becoming infected.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn stain on the carpet seemed to be ulcering, resisting all cleaning attempts.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was ulcering, ready to burst at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The neglected garden was ulcering with weeds, spreading uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: His doctor explained the ulcering of the skin due to poor circulation.
meanings.sent2: The ulcering in her stomach was causing her discomfort after meals.
meanings.sent3: The rapid ulcering of the road surface made driving a bumpy experience.
meanings.sent4: The ulcering of the relationship between the two friends was evident in their constant arguments.
meanings.sent5: The ulcering of the old building's walls revealed years of neglect and decay.
